body.p: includes a variety of features that were designed specifically for DITA Map document types. Most of these features can be accessed through actions available on the DITA Map framework-specific toolbar or from the contextual menu.

section.title: DITA Map New Document Templates
section.p: includes a variety of predefined new document templates that make it easy to create various types of DITA documents with some of the document structure already present. When you use the New button in the Dashboard for your particular file repository, a dialog box is displayed where you can choose from various types of new document templates, including Map, Bookmap, Subject Scheme, and other types of DITA maps.

section.title: DITA Map Toolbar Actions
section.p: The following default actions are readily available on the toolbar when editing a DITA map document in :

dlentry.dt: DITA Map Display Mode Drop-Down Menu
dlentry.dd:
This drop-down menu offers three possibilities for choosing how the DITA map is displayed:
View Topic References Display the map with the topic references shown.
View Topic Titles Displays the map with both titles and topic references shown.
View Topic Content Displays the map with all of the topic content expanded in one document without having to open each topic individually to see the content. This mode is helpful for previewing the entire content of a DITA map.By default, to prevent performance issues, the View Topic Content mode is not available if the DITA map contains more than 50 references. This amount can be configured with the topic.content.refs.limit option.
Opens a dialog box where you can choose the type of DITA document to create and inserts a reference to it at the current position within the map.
Opens a dialog box where you can choose a topic and inserts a reference to it at the current position within the map.
Inserts an empty relationship table at the current position.
Inserts a new table row with empty cells. The action is available when the cursor position is inside a relationship table.
Inserts a new table column with empty cells after the current column. The action is available when the cursor position is inside a relationship table.
Deletes the table column where the cursor is located.
Deletes the table row where the cursor is located.
Moves the selected node up one position on its same level.
Moves the selected node down one position on its same level.
Moves the selected node up one level to the level of its parent node.
Moves the selected node down one level to the level of its child nodes.

section.title: DITA Contextual Menu Actions
section.p: There are various actions that are available in the contextual menu when editing DITA map documents in :

dlentry.dd:
This submenu includes the following insert actions that are specific to the DITA Map framework:
Insert New DITA Resource Opens a dialog box where you can choose the type of DITA document to create and inserts a reference to it at the current position within the map.
Insert Topic Reference Opens a dialog box where you can choose a topic and inserts a reference to it at the current position within the map.

dlentry.dt: Relationship Table submenu (Available when invoked on a relationship table)
dlentry.dd: Presents various actions for configuring the relationship table, such as adding or deleting rows and columns.

section.title: Special Icons
section.p:
There are a few special icons that are displayed in DITA maps next to topic references that contain certain attributes set to no:
- This icon is displayed if a topic reference has the toc attribute set to no.
- This icon is displayed if a topic reference has the print attribute set to no.
